alert.note: Alert for Northern Clearwater Mountains; Orofino, Grangeville Region; Southern Clearwater Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 03 at 5:56PM MDT until May 07 at 9:58AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: .Showers and thunderstorms capable of heavy rain are expected to develop Thursday afternoon and evening, with additional periods of moderate to heavy rain expected during the day on Friday. This rainfall, combined with continued snow melt, will lead to additional rises in area creeks and streams. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Idaho and north central Idaho, including the following areas, in central Idaho, Orofino/Grangeville Region and Southern Clearwater Mountains. In north central Idaho, Northern Clearwater Mountains. Williams Creek burn scar area, near Orogrande, is especially susceptible to flooding from heavy rain on top of snow melt. * WHEN...Through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain with showers and thunderstorms over the next couple of days will combine with continued snow melt to bring area creeks out of their banks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

area.areaDesc: Northern Clearwater Mountains; Orofino, Grangeville Region; Southern Clearwater Mountains
